name: Present Simple
description: Basic tense for habits, routines, and general truths

discover.text: I wake up at 7 every day. My sister wakes up at 8. We eat breakfast together. She drinks coffee, but I drink tea. After breakfast, I go to work. I work in an office. My job starts at 9 and finishes at 5. I like my job because I help people.

understand.rule:
Present Simple is used for:
1. Habits and routines (I wake up at 7)
2. General truths (The sun rises in the east)
3. Permanent states (I live in Moscow)

Form:
• I/You/We/They + verb (work, go, like)
• He/She/It + verb + s/es (works, goes, likes)
tips: Add -es after s, sh, ch, x, o: go → goes, watch → watches
Change -y to -ies: study → studies (but: play → plays)

texts: Tom gets up early every morning. He has breakfast at 7:30. He usually eats toast and drinks orange juice. Then he goes to school by bus. School starts at 8:30.
My mother works in a bank. She leaves home at 8 and comes back at 6. She loves her job. My father doesn't work. He stays at home and cooks dinner.
notice.findPattern: Find all Present Simple verbs. Pay attention to -s endings!

exercises.explanation: My brother = He, so we need plays (verb + s)

prompts: Write 5 sentences about your daily routine using Present Simple.
Describe what your family members do every day.
Write about your habits. What do you always/usually/sometimes/never do?
